user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_virt2phys:
```c
static int metal_virt2phys(void *addr, unsigned long *phys)
{
	off_t offset;
	uint64_t entry;
	int error;

	if (_metal.pagemap_fd < 0)
		return -EINVAL;

	offset = ((uintptr_t)addr >> _metal.page_shift) * sizeof(entry);
	error = pread(_metal.pagemap_fd, &entry, sizeof(entry), offset);
	if (error < 0) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "failed pagemap pread (offset %llx) - %s\n",
			  (unsigned long long)offset, strerror(errno));
		return -errno;
	}

	/* Check page present and not swapped. */
	if ((entry >> 62) != 2) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_ERROR, "pagemap page not present, %llx -> %llx\n",
			  (unsigned long long)offset, (unsigned long long)entry);
		return -ENOENT;
	}

	*phys = (entry & ((1ULL << 54) - 1)) << _metal.page_shift;
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function metal_virt2phys:
#define metal_log(level, fmt, __VA_ARGS__) ({if(_metal.common.log_handler&&level<=_metal.common.log_level)_metal.common.log_handler(level,metal_fmt(fmt),##__VA_ARGS__);\
})
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No uses of memcmp are present in the provided function or the related macro. The function performs binary operations on a uint64_t entry read from /proc/self/pagemap and does not perform any string comparisons; the only string-related use is strerror(errno) passed to the logging macro (used for output with %s), not compared. The metal_log macro shown only formats/logs messages and does not call memcmp. Therefore there are no code fragments in the supplied code that match MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings) and no fragments need further investigation for this rule.
